thread.section_title: TrekEarth - South America Travel Photo Gallery
thread.title: Cove of Abraham

title: Cove of Abraham
text:
Only registered TrekEarth members may write critiques. Photographer's Note 
Here in the cove of Abraham lives a friendly town, Vila do Abraao that is the largest of communities across the Big Island and the main tourism gateway, assuming the role of "economic capital" of the Big Island. The cove has its very jagged surroundings, being made up of 14 beaches and 5 islets. The relief of the mountains is the turning point, presented Steep peaks and altitude with beautiful forms, and the most curious Parrot Peak. It has several streams coming down from the mountains and flowing into the beaches. The largest beach is that of Abraham in the bottom of the cove, where the village residents, shopping center, places of embarkation and disembarkation, intense movement of boats that perform excursions and the link with the mainland. The village has several restaurants, night activities, bars, and is therefore much frequented by young people. 
Nobody has marked this note useful
